metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the sol-def:package_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the sol-def:package_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the package_object is supported with the pkinst entity equal to some value.
Test that the package_object is supported with the pkinst entity not equal to some value.
Test that the package_object is supported with the pkinst entity matching some regular expression.

package_test.comment: Test that the package_object is supported with the pkinst entity equal to some value.
Test that the package_object is supported with the pkinst entity not equal to some value.
Test that the package_object is supported with the pkinst entity matching some regular expression.

package_object.comment: Retrieve a package_item with a package instance equal to 'SUNWinst'.
Retrieve package_items with a pakage instance that is not equal to 'SUNWinst'.
Retrieve package_items with a package instance that matches the regular expression '^[S][U][N][W]inst$'.

package_state.comment: This state represents a package_item that has a package instance equal to 'SUNWinst', a name equal to 'Install Software', a category equal to 'system', and a version that matches the regular expression '.*'.
package_state.name: Install Software

package_state.comment: This state represents package_items that have a package instance not equal to 'SUNWinst', a name not equal to 'Install Software', and a version that matches the regular expression '.*'.
package_state.name: Install Software

package_state.comment: This state represents package_items that have a package instance that matches the regular expression '^[S][U][N][W]inst$', a name equal to 'Install Software', and a version that matches the regular expression '.*'.
package_state.name: Install Software
